questions.text: The flap shown in the picture is? (AIIMS NOV 2017)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Serratus anterior flap

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Flap surgery is a type of plastic surgery that uses tissues from another part of the body to close open wounds while having its own blood supply. The site from which the tissue is obtained is called the donor site, while the site where the tissue is transferred is called the recipient site. Flaps may be of soft tissue, skin, muscle, bone, fat or fascia.
  • ➤ Flap surgery is a type of plastic surgery that uses tissues from another part of the body to close open wounds while having its own blood supply.
  • ➤ The site from which the tissue is obtained is called the donor site, while the site where the tissue is transferred is called the recipient site. Flaps may be of soft tissue, skin, muscle, bone, fat or fascia.

questions.text: A 52-year-old woman came to the OPD with a diagnosis of advanced cervical cancer. She has a 14-year-old daughter. What advice would you give for her daughter? (NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Advise HPV vaccine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The HPV vaccine is essential for preventing cervical cancer and should be administered to girls aged 9 to 14 years, ideally before the onset of sexual activity.

questions.text: Best test for the diagnosis of disease malaria species is: ( INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Thin smear with Giemsa

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Thin smear with Giemsa stain is the best method for detailed malaria species identification due to its ability to highlight specific morphological features of the Plasmodium parasites.

questions.text: What would be a useful diagnostic tool to consider for a patient who presented with symptoms of hair loss, itching of the scalp, and a mild discharge? ( AIIMS May 2017)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) KOH mount

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ref: Rook's Textbook of Dermatology - Volume II-9th Edition Chapter 32 Page no 32.39
  • ➤ Ref: Rook's Textbook of Dermatology - Volume II-9th Edition Chapter 32 Page no 32.39

questions.text: Identify the condition: (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Bladder exstrophy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Bladder exstrophy is a congenital abnormality characterized by an open and exposed bladder due to incomplete formation of the lower abdominal wall. The management involves staged surgical reconstruction, and complications include strictures, hyperchloremic acidosis, and increased risk of tumors.

questions.text: A 29-year-old woman presents for her routine first-trimester ultrasound at approximately 7.5 weeks of gestation. The ultrasound reveals two distinct small bubbles within the gestational sac, giving a characteristic double bleb appearance. The clinician identifies this finding and reassures the patient that it is typical for this stage of pregnancy. What is the double bleb sign seen in early pregnancy due to?
questions.correct_answer: B. Yolk sac and amniotic sac
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Yolk sac and amniotic sac

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The double bleb sign in early pregnancy ultrasound is due to the presence of the yolk sac and the amniotic sac within the gestational sac. It is a normal finding that confirms early intrauterine pregnancy. The double decidual sign, on the other hand, involves the decidua capsularis and decidua parietalis, which are not part of the double bleb sign.

questions.text: The vector shown in the image below transmits which of the following organism? ( INICET MAY 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Orientia tsutsugamushi

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The trombiculid mite, particularly in its larval stage called a chigger, transmits Orientia tsutsugamushi, the causative agent of scrub typhus.
  • ➤ The trombiculid mite, particularly in its larval stage called a chigger, transmits Orientia tsutsugamushi, the causative agent of scrub typhus.

questions.text: The following test is positive for identification of: (INICET MAY 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Candida albicans

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The germ tube test is used for the presumptive identification of Candida albicans. It detects the formation of germ tubes, which are characteristic of Candida albicans and Candida dubliniensis but not other Candida species. Germ tubes are short, slender, tube-like structures without constriction at their point of origin, differentiating them from pseudohyphae.

questions.text: When asked the patient to stand on left foot, right side went down. Which structures are involved in this case? (INICET NOV 2023) Superior gluteal nerve Gluteus minimus Gluteus medius Sciatic nerve
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 1, 2, 3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A positive Trendelenburg sign, where the pelvis drops on the opposite side when standing on one foot, indicates weakness or paralysis of the gluteus medius and minimus muscles, which are innervated by the superior gluteal nerve.

questions.text: Dr. Sharma, the head of the pediatric department at a renowned medical college in Uttar Pradesh, is conducting a training session for new medical officers. As part of the session, he aims to ensure the officers are well-versed with the national health programs related to child health. He poses the question, "Under the Rashtriya Bal Swashthya Karyakram (RBSK) initiative, which of these diseases is not covered? (AIIMS MAY 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Congenital glaucoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Targeted diseases:
  • ➤ Targeted diseases:

questions.text: Which of the following is true about pegylated-filgrastim? (NEET PG 2019)

options.label: A
options.text: Duration of action is longer than filgrastim

options.label: B
options.text: Added advantage is that it can be taken orally

options.label: C
options.text: It is contraindicated in patients with sickle cell anemia

options.label: D
options.text: It is not effective in the treatment of severe neutropenia

questions.correct_answer: A. Duration of action is longer than filgrastim
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Duration of action is longer than filgrastim

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pegylated-filgrastim has a longer duration of action than regular filgrastim due to its pegylation, which slows its clearance from the body. It is effective in the treatment of severe neutropenia and is administered by injection, not orally. While not contraindicated in sickle cell anemia, caution is advised due to the potential risk of stimulating white blood cell production and increasing the risk of sickling crises.

questions.text: Foreign body entry into the laryngeal inlet is prevented by the cough reflex. This reflex is sluggish in alcohol ingestion and some other conditions. Which nerve is likely injured? (INICET MAY 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Internal laryngeal nerve

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Damage to or inhibition of the internal laryngeal nerve can significantly impair the cough reflex by reducing the sensory input required to detect irritants above the vocal cords, emphasizing its pivotal role in this protective reflex.
  • ➤ Ref - Dhingra 7th edition, Page No. 337
  • ➤ Ref - Dhingra 7th edition, Page No. 337

questions.text: A patient has complained of fever with chills. A throat examination reveals swollen glands and a thick, whitish membrane over his tonsils. Albert staining is to be done. What are the constituents of Albert's stain? ( INICET NOV 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Toluidine and malachite green

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Albert stain contains Toluidine blue and Malachite green, used to identify metachromatic granules in bacteria like Corynebacterium diphtheriae.

questions.text: A pregnant woman with 35 weeks+5 days gestation complains of epigastric pain, headache, and blurring of vision. Her blood pressure is 170/110 mmHg. She is in labor pain. Examination of the cervix shows a 3 cm dilatation with a bag of liquor. What is the appropriate management? (INICET NOV 2022)

options.label: B
options.text: Administer tocolytics and deliver at 37 wks

options.label: C
options.text: Give steroid cover and wait until steroid cover is complete.

options.label: D
options.text: Treat hypertension, administer MgSO4, and consider termination of pregnancy.

questions.correct_answer: D. Treat hypertension, administer MgSO4, and consider termination of pregnancy.
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Treat hypertension, administer MgSO4, and consider termination of pregnancy.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of severe pre-eclampsia at or beyond 34 weeks of gestation, immediate management involves controlling hypertension, administering magnesium sulfate to prevent seizures, and expediting delivery.
  • ➤ Ref: Williams textbook of obstetrics 26 th edition pg 1850, Dutta’s textbook of obstetrics 8 th edition pg267
  • ➤ Ref: Williams textbook of obstetrics 26 th edition pg 1850, Dutta’s textbook of obstetrics 8 th edition pg267

questions.text: A researcher is investigating whether a correlation exists between CRP values and the likelihood of experiencing myocardial infarction or stroke. The participants in the study were split into five groups and the following table is formed based on the study results. Among the provided options, which statement accurately reflects the connection between CRP levels and the risk of myocardial infarction/stroke? (NEET PG 2021) (CRP à C-reactive protein)

options.label: A
options.text: CRP has no association with risk of MI/stroke

options.label: B
options.text: Increase in CRP leads to increased risk of MI/Stroke

options.label: C
options.text: Increase in CRP decreases the risk of Ml/stroke

options.label: D
options.text: In group 1, there is no risk of MI/stroke

questions.correct_answer: B. Increase in CRP leads to increased risk of MI/Stroke
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Increase in CRP leads to increased risk of MI/Stroke

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Increased CRP levels are positively associated with an increased risk of myocardial infarction (MI) and stroke. As CRP levels rise, the relative risk of these conditions also increases.

questions.text: What is the most common tumor of the lacrimal gland? ( INICET May 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Pleomorphic adenoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pleomorphic adenoma is the most common tumor of the lacrimal gland while adenoid cystic carcinoma is the most common carcinoma of the lacrimal gland.

questions.text: A patient has recurrent optic neuritis of both eyes with extensive transverse myelitis. Visual acuity in the right eye is 6/60 and visual acuity in the left eye 6/18. The patient showed a partial response to steroids. What is the likely diagnosis? (AIIMS MAY 2019)

options.label: C
options.text: Subacute combined degeneration of spinal cord

questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Neuromyelitis optica

questions.text: A researcher in epidemiology is planning to conduct a meta-analysis to better understand the effects of a specific intervention. While he lists the various stages and processes associated with a meta-analysis, he includes one element that isn't typically involved in a meta-analysis. Which of the following isn't directly associated with the process of a meta-analysis? (INICET NOV 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Randomization

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Randomization is a part of conducting individual randomized controlled trials, not the process of performing a meta-analysis.
  • ➤ Randomization is a part of conducting individual randomized controlled trials, not the process of performing a meta-analysis.

questions.text: A nutritionist is counseling a patient on the energy expenditure associated with digesting and assimilating different nutrients. The patient asks which type of nutrient requires the most energy for the body to process. Based on the body's metabolic requirements, which of the following requires the maximum energy for assimilation?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. Proteins

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Proteins require the maximum energy for assimilation among the nutrients listed because of their complex structure and the extensive metabolic processes involved in breaking them down into individual amino acids. Understanding the energy demands of different nutrients helps in managing diet and optimizing metabolism.

questions.text: A public health officer is reviewing populations targeted by the HIV sentinel surveillance program. Which group is NOT traditionally included in HIV sentinel surveillance? (INICET NOV 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) STD clinic attendees

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The sites for HIV sentinel surveillance includes:
  • ➤ A pregnant woman of reproductive age and attending the antenatal clinic for the first time. Female sex workers. Hijra/Transgenders. IV drug users Truckers. Homosexual Men Migrants.
  • ➤ A pregnant woman of reproductive age and attending the antenatal clinic for the first time.
  • ➤ Female sex workers.
  • ➤ Hijra/Transgenders.
  • ➤ IV drug users
  • ➤ Truckers.
  • ➤ Homosexual Men
  • ➤ Migrants.

questions.text: A woman with a history of infertility is on treatment with human gonadotropin. She presented with the following finding in the USG. What is the most likely diagnosis? ( NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ OHSS is characterized by multiple enlarged ovarian follicles and fluid accumulation in the pelvic cavity, often occurring after exogenous gonadotropin administration in infertility treatments.
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 456, Williams Gynecology 3 rd edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 456, Williams Gynecology 3 rd edition

questions.text: Identify the grip in the image given below: (INICET NOV 2017)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Pawlik grip

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Pawlik grip (third Leopold maneuver) involves grasping the lower portion of the maternal abdomen just above the symphysis pubis to assess the engagement of the presenting part of the fetus.

  • ➤ Ref: Page no 89-90, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Obstetrics 8 th edition

questions.text: Which of the following would most likely lead to a decrease in the intensity of the murmur in a patient with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy? (NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Squatting

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Increasing preload (e.g., through squatting) reduces LVOT obstruction in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, leading to a decrease in the murmur's intensity.

questions.text: Which diagnostic tool is preferred for metabolic disease screening in children? (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Tandem mass spectrometry

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Tandem mass spectrometry is the gold standard for screening inborn errors of metabolism in children due to its ability to detect multiple metabolic disorders from a single blood sample.

questions.text: Relapse is seen in? (INICET MAY 2017)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Plasmodium viva and ovale

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Relapse in malaria is seen in cases of Plasmodium vivax and Plasmodium ovale due to the presence of hypnozoites, the dormant liver stages that can reactivate and cause renewed infection.

questions.text: True about telomeres and telomerase is:(NEET PG 2022)

options.label: B
options.text: Gradually decreasing length of telomeres with ageing

options.label: D
options.text: Telomerase is found in somatic cells

questions.correct_answer: B. Gradually decreasing length of telomeres with ageing
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Gradually decreasing length of telomeres with ageing

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Telomeres are end of chromosomes and do not contain any coding sequences. Instead it has TTAGGG sequence repeated ‘n’ no. of times.
  • ➤ Telomerase is enzyme present only in the germ/stem cells and is responsible for maintaining the length of telomeres due to its RNA dependent DNA polymerase activity.
  • ➤ In Somatic cells, absence of telomerase enzyme (option d is false) results in telomere shortening as the cells ages .
  • ➤ .

References:

  • ↳ Reference : Harper’s 31 st ed/pg- 355, 716

questions.text: An elderly male patient who received a kidney transplant a decade ago is presently under immunosuppressive treatment. He reports experiencing a persistent cough and shortness of breath over the past week. Microscopic examination of his sputum reveals the presence of gram-positive budding yeast cells and pseudohyphae. What is the probable diagnosis in this case? (INICET MAY 2023)

options.label: D
options.text: Information is not enough for the diagnosis

questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Invasive candidiasis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Invasive candidiasis is characterized by the presence of gram-positive budding yeast cells and pseudohyphae in tissue or clinical specimens, especially in immunocompromised patients.

questions.text: Which of the following is high-molecular weight glycoprotein of the extracellular matrix that binds to integrins? ( AIIMS May 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Fibronectin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fibronectin is a key component of the extracellular matrix that interacts with cell surface integrins to mediate various cellular processes including adhesion, migration, and tissue repair.

questions.text: A 26-year-old female presents to the ER with menorrhagia. She mentions that her father and sister also suffer from bleeding disorders. Which of the following is likely? (INICET NOV 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Von Willebrand Disease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Von Willebrand Disease is an autosomal dominant disorder presenting with bleeding symptoms like menorrhagia and is more common in females compared to Hemophilia A or B, which are X-linked recessive and primarily affect males.

questions.text: A 23-year-old male presents with progressive hearing loss and persistent tinnitus in the right ear. He reports difficulty understanding conversations and occasional episodes of dizziness. Physical examination is unremarkable, but audiometric testing shows sensorineural hearing loss on the right side. An MRI reveals a mass at the cerebellopontine angle. A biopsy is performed, and the histological image provided shows distinctive features of the tumor. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Acoustic neuroma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Acoustic neuroma presents with unilateral hearing loss, tinnitus, and histological features of Antoni A and B areas with Verocay bodies. Proper diagnosis relies on imaging and histological findings, with surgical intervention often required for management.

questions.text: The type of fibers present in the fornix are? ( INICET May 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Association and commisural fibers

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The fornix contains both association fibers (linking parts of the hippocampus to other regions within the same hemisphere) and commissural fibers (connecting the hippocampi of the two hemispheres).
  • ➤ Association fibers : These fibers connect different parts of the same hemisphere. Their function is to enable communication between different cortical areas within the same cerebral hemisphere.
  • ➤ Association fibers
  • ➤ Commissural fibers : These are axons that connect one cerebral hemisphere to the other. Their primary function is to allow the two hemispheres to communicate with each other. The corpus callosum is the most significant group of commissural fibers, but the fornix also contains commissural fibers. Specifically, fibers from the fornix contribute to the hippocampal commissure, which connects the two hippocampi of the right and left hemispheres.
  • ➤ Commissural fibers

questions.text: What is the chromosome number of a partial hydatidiform mole? ( NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) 69 XXY

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Partial hydatidiform moles are triploid, typically having a chromosome number of 69, which can be 69XXX or 69XXY.
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 616, Williams Obstetrics 26 th edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 616, Williams Obstetrics 26 th edition

questions.text: Which of the following is not a feature of the optic disc in glaucoma? ( INICET Nov 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Roenne's nasal step

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Roenne's nasal step, while indicative of the functional impact of glaucoma, does not represent a direct observation of the optic disc but is rather a manifestation of the disease's effect on the visual field.

questions.text: Identify the ‘1’ in the picture: ( AIIMS Nov 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Cystoid Macular Edema

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cystoid Macular Edema (CME) often presents with a petaloid pattern on fluorescein angiography due to pooling of dye in cystic spaces of the macula and is associated with various underlying conditions affecting the vascular integrity of the retina.

questions.text: 2,3-BPG causes the unloading of oxygen to tissues by? (INICET NOV 2022)

options.label: B
options.text: Binding to beta subunit of Hb

questions.correct_answer: B. Binding to beta subunit of Hb
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Binding to beta subunit of Hb

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ 2,3-Bisphosphoglycerate (BPG) binds to the beta subunits of hemoglobin, decreasing its affinity for oxygen and promoting oxygen release to the tissues. This mechanism is crucial for adapting to conditions requiring increased oxygen delivery, such as high altitude and exercise.

questions.text: A man exposes his genitalia to a female passerby on the road. This method of deriving sexual gratification by observing the people that look at him nude is best described as? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Exhibitionism

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: Which of the following supplement is required more for a lactating woman than the pregnant female? (INICET MAY 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Vitamin A

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Vitamin A is required more for a lactating woman than a pregnant female. This increased need ensures that there is enough vitamin A in breast milk to support the baby's growth and development, particularly for their immune system and vision.
  • ➤ Vitamins and mineral requirement for pregnant and lactating women
  • ➤ Vitamins and mineral requirement for pregnant and lactating women
  • ➤ The above table shows the Vitamins A and C are required in significantly higher quantity during the lactation while Folate and iron are required in higher quantity during pregnancy. All other minerals and vitamin (Not shown in table) have similar requirements under both conditions.

questions.text: A 45-year-old banker presented with vague abdominal pain. An initial ultrasound revealed a renal mass lesion, and a contrast-enhanced CT (CECT) was performed as shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Angiomyolipoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Angiomyolipomas are benign renal tumors characterized by the presence of macroscopic fat, seen as low attenuation areas on CT scans. This feature is key in differentiating them from other renal masses such as RCCs and oncocytomas. Understanding these imaging characteristics aids in the accurate diagnosis and management of renal lesions.

questions.text: A 2-month-old infant is brought to the OPD with a parietal swelling present since birth. An X-ray was ordered and is shown below. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Cephalhematoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cephalhematoma is a localized hematoma under the periosteum of the skull bone in newborns, confined by suture lines and typically associated with birth trauma.

questions.text: Most radio-resistant phase of cell cycle? ( INICET Nov 2021)
questions.explanation: Ans. B) S

They seek a reliable method for real-time assessment of these practices. Which of the following would be the most appropriate method to monitor the injection practices of health workers? (AIIMS NOV 2019)

options.label: A

options.label: D
options.text: In-depth interview with the healthcare provider

questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Direct observation with a structured checklist

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The most effective approach for assessing the injection practices of healthcare workers is through direct observation using a structured checklist.
  • ➤ The most effective approach for assessing the injection practices of healthcare workers is through direct observation using a structured checklist.

questions.text: A woman presented with morning stiffness that gradually resolves over one hour. Which of the following statements is correct regarding this condition? (INICET NOV 2020) NSAIDs can improve the symptoms and have disease modifying activity. Absence of erosion rules out the diagnosis. It is associated with raised ESR and CRP. HLA DR4 is related to the prognosis
questions.explanation:
Ans. D)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Rheumatoid arthritis presents with raised serum ESR and quantitative CRP levels, and HLA DR4 positivity.
  • ➤ Rheumatoid arthritis presents with raised serum ESR and quantitative CRP levels, and HLA DR4 positivity.

questions.text: A first year MBBS student presented to OPD with intermittent episodes of impending doom accompanied by profuse sweating. The episodes usually occur before her exams. What is the most likely cause? (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Panic disorder

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Panic disorder is characterized by recurrent episodes of panic attack. Panic attack is a sudden, intense episode of fear or discomfort often accompanied by a sensation of impending doom . The symptoms during panic attack usually involve sudden onset of palpitations, chest pain, choking sensations, dizziness and feeling of unreality (depersonalization or derealization).Along with these physical symptoms there is also fear of dying, losing control or going mad .
  • ➤ a sensation of impending doom
  • ➤ palpitations, chest pain, choking sensations,
  • ➤ fear of dying, losing control
  • ➤ going mad

References:

  • ↳ Reference: Kaplan & Sadock’s Synopsis of Psychiatry, 11th edition, Page No 394.

questions.text: A 26-year-old woman who is being treated for infertility with human menopausal gonadotropin presented with complaints of sudden abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, and breathlessness. The finding of the ultrasound is shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome (OHSS) is characterized by multiple follicular development and ovarian enlargement following hCG stimulation, with symptoms including abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, and breathlessness, often visible on ultrasound as enlarged ovaries with large cysts.

questions.text: Artery supplying near marked structure is (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Anterior interventricular artery

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The anterior interventricular artery (LAD) supplies the anterior two-thirds of the interventricular septum and is critical for heart function, making it a key vessel in coronary circulation.

questions.text: A lady was discharged after a normal vaginal delivery. On the third day she came back with fever, tachycardia and seizures. Fundus showed papilledema with no focal deficits. Diagnosis is? (INICET MAY 2017)
questions.explanation:

  • ➤ Cortical/ Cerebral vein thrombosis should be thought of in a patient with headache and seizures/ other neurological deficits following delivery
  • ➤ Cortical/ Cerebral vein thrombosis should be thought of in a patient with headache and seizures/ other neurological deficits following delivery

questions.correct_answer: B. Two finger breadths below umbilicus
questions.explanation:

questions.text: Loss of flexion at the interphalangeal joint of thumb after supracondylar fracture is due to the involvement of? ( AIIMS May 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. Anterior interosseous nerve

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Flexion of thumb occurs at 2 joints:
  • ➤ Flexion of thumb occurs at 2 joints:
  • ➤ IP joint: Flexor pollicis longs (FPL) supplied by the anterior interosseous nerve (a branch of the median nerve, C7 and C8). MCP joint: Flexor pollicis brevis (FPB supplied by the recurrent motor branch of the median nerve.
  • ➤ IP joint: Flexor pollicis longs (FPL) supplied by the anterior interosseous nerve (a branch of the median nerve, C7 and C8).
  • ➤ MCP joint: Flexor pollicis brevis (FPB supplied by the recurrent motor branch of the median nerve.
  • ➤ Most commonly injured nerve in SCH fracture: AIN > Median > Radial > Ulnar (AMRU)
  • ➤ AIN > Median > Radial > Ulnar (AMRU)
  • ➤ Deep branch of ulnar nerve → ulnar claw hand Posterior interosseous nerve → innervates the extensor muscles of the wrist and fingers. Weakness or paralysis of these muscles can cause difficulty in extending the wrist and fingers
  • ➤ Deep branch of ulnar nerve → ulnar claw hand
  • ➤ Posterior interosseous nerve → innervates the extensor muscles of the wrist and fingers. Weakness or paralysis of these muscles can cause difficulty in extending the wrist and fingers

questions.text: According to wound ballistics, A gunshot wound showing burning, blackening, tattooing around the wound, can be classified as: ( NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A Close shot entry wound

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Entry Wound features:
  • ➤ Entry Wound features:
  • ➤ Contact Shot: Burning, blackening and tattooing present just on the margin; not around the wound. Very minimally visible. Close Shot: Burning, blackening and tattooing present in large amount around the wound (esp. blackening is prominent) Intermediate Range: Only Tattooing present around the wound Distant range: None of these present around the wound.
  • ➤ Contact Shot: Burning, blackening and tattooing present just on the margin; not around the wound. Very minimally visible.
  • ➤ Contact Shot:
  • ➤ Close Shot: Burning, blackening and tattooing present in large amount around the wound (esp. blackening is prominent)
  • ➤ Close Shot:
  • ➤ Intermediate Range: Only Tattooing present around the wound
  • ➤ Intermediate Range:
  • ➤ Distant range: None of these present around the wound.
  • ➤ Distant range:

questions.text: All of the following features are seen in chronic arsenic poisoning except? ( INICET May 2022)

Ans. D. Luminous vomit

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Features seen in chronic arsenic poisoning:
  • ➤ Features seen in chronic arsenic poisoning:
  • ➤ 1. Peripheral neuropathy (neuritis):
  • ➤ 1. Peripheral neuropathy (neuritis):
  • ➤ It can occur in Arsenic , Thallium , Mercury, and Lead.
  • ➤ Lead: Mainly motor, little bit sensory neuropathy
  • ➤ Lead:
  • ➤ Arsenic, Thallium, mercury: mainly sensory, little bit motor neuropathy
  • ➤ Arsenic, Thallium, mercury:

  • ➤ 2) Skin symptoms:
  • ➤ - Hypopigmentation initially
  • ➤ - Rain Drop Pigmentation as shown below
  • ➤ - Peculiar skin rash – resembles Addison’s disease , Fading measles rash
  • ➤ - Hyperkeratosis of palms & soles as shown below:
  • ➤ 3) Nails: Aldrich Mees Lines
  • ➤ 3) Nails:
  • ➤ Transverse whitish lines on nails (seen is Arsenic, and Thallium)
  • ➤ 4) Hair: Alopecia seen in M ercury, A rsenic, T hallium (Mnemonic: Hair on MAT )
  • ➤ 4) Hair:
  • ➤ M
  • ➤ A
  • ➤ T

  • ➤ 5) GIT:

questions.text: Which of the following is seen in placenta previa? (INICET NOV 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Warning bleeds

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Placenta previa typically presents with painless, recurrent vaginal bleeding (warning bleeds) in the third trimester or during labor, with a soft, non-tender uterus.
  • ➤ Ref: William’s textbook of obstetrics 26 th edition pg1940, Dutta’s textbook of obstetrics 8 th edition pg 307
  • ➤ Ref: William’s textbook of obstetrics 26 th edition pg1940, Dutta’s textbook of obstetrics 8 th edition pg 307

questions.text: A 45-year-old male patient. During emergency resuscitation, he is administered a 20% Intralipid injection, leading to stabilization of his symptoms. Based on the treatment provided, what was the most probable diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Local anesthetic systemic toxicity (LAST)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Intralipid (20% lipid emulsion) is the treatment of choice for local anesthetic systemic toxicity (LAST), where it acts as a lipid sink to sequester local anesthetics from critical tissues. Understanding the clinical presentation of LAST and the role of Intralipid is crucial in emergency settings to prevent severe neurological and cardiovascular complications.

questions.text: Reema Devi, A 28y newly married woman presents to your sub center for contraceptive advice. She is started on Oral Contraceptive Pills. She presents after 2 weeks with a history of missing 4 tablets on different days in the first 2 weeks of the cycle. What will you advise her? (NEET PG 2021)

options.label: A
options.text: Discontinue the packet and start an alternate method of contraception

options.label: B
options.text: Take 4 tablets the next day, continue the remaining packet, use additional contraception (condom) and give Emergency Pill if h/o intercourse in the last 72 h

options.label: C
options.text: Take the next pill as soon as possible, continue the remaining packet, use additional contraception (condom) and give Emergency Pill if h/o intercourse in the last 72 h

options.label: D
options.text: Take the next pill as soon as possible and continue the remaining tablets

questions.correct_answer: C. Take the next pill as soon as possible, continue the remaining packet, use additional contraception (condom) and give Emergency Pill if h/o intercourse in the last 72 h
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Take the next pill as soon as possible, continue the remaining packet, use additional contraception (condom) and give Emergency Pill if h/o intercourse in the last 72 h

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ If a woman misses multiple oral contraceptive pills, she should take the last missed pill as soon as possible, continue the remaining packet, use additional contraception, and consider emergency contraception if she had intercourse in the last 72 hours.

questions.text: What is seen in G6PD deficiency? ( INICET May 2021)

options.label: D
options.text: Decrease scavanging of RBC by macrophages

questions.correct_answer: B. Decrease generation of reduced glutathione
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Decrease generation of reduced glutathione

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ G6PD deficiency is associated with a decrease in the generation of reduced glutathione , leading to increased oxidative stress and susceptibility of red blood cells to damage and hemolysis.
  • ➤ Ref - Harper 31 st e/p 185-186
  • ➤ Ref - Harper 31 st e/p 185-186

questions.text: A doctor tells a 31-year-old woman, who is 20 weeks pregnant, that her baby has a developmental defect. She has come to you for a second opinion. The following US finding is seen. Identify the defect? (INICET NOV 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Anencephaly

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Anencephaly is an open neural tube defect characterized by the absence of the cranial calvaria and prominent orbits, detectable by ultrasound as early as 10 to 11 weeks of gestation. It can be prevented with pre-conceptional folic acid supplementation.
  • ➤ Ref: William’s textbook of obstetrics 24 th edition pg 201, Dutta’s textbook of obstetrics 8 th edition pg471
  • ➤ Ref: William’s textbook of obstetrics 24 th edition pg 201, Dutta’s textbook of obstetrics 8 th edition pg471

questions.text: The scope of Project MONICA includes: (NEET PG 2020
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Cardiovascular diseases

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The scope of Project MONICA is focused on cardiovascular diseases, specifically monitoring trends in coronary heart disease and cerebrovascular disease and examining the impact of various risk factors on these conditions.

questions.text: What is the fluid of choice in pediatric patients? (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) DNS

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The fluid of choice in pediatric patients is DNS (Dextrose Normal Saline), which provides essential hydration, electrolytes, and glucose for energy.

questions.text: What does the provided formula correspond to? (INICET NOV 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Standard deviation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Standard deviation is the deviation of each value from the standard value [Mean].
  • ➤ Standard deviation is the deviation of each value from the standard value [Mean].

questions.text: A 52-year-old woman diagnosed with carcinoma cervix stage 2B was advised radiotherapy. Which of the following statements regarding radiotherapy is false? (NEET PG 2020)

options.label: A
options.text: Point B is 3 cm lateral to point A

options.label: B
options.text: Point A is 2 cm above the external os and 5 cm lateral to the internal uterine canal

options.label: C
options.text: Point A receives a dose of 7000 cGy

options.label: D
options.text: Point B receives a dose of 6000 cGy

questions.correct_answer: B. Point A is 2 cm above the external os and 5 cm lateral to the internal uterine canal
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Point A is 2 cm above the external os and 5 cm lateral to the internal uterine canal

Explanation:

  • • False Statement Explanation
  • • Point A is 2 cm above the external os and 5 cm lateral to the internal uterine canal : This statement is false because Point A is defined as 2 cm lateral and 2 cm superior to the external cervical os, not 5 cm lateral.
  • • Point A is 2 cm above the external os and 5 cm lateral to the internal uterine canal : This statement is false because Point A is defined as 2 cm lateral and 2 cm superior to the external cervical os, not 5 cm lateral.
  • • Point A is 2 cm above the external os and 5 cm lateral to the internal uterine canal
  • • This statement is false because Point A is defined as 2 cm lateral and 2 cm superior to the external cervical os, not 5 cm lateral.
  • • This statement is false because Point A is defined as 2 cm lateral and 2 cm superior to the external cervical os, not 5 cm lateral.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Point A in cervical cancer radiotherapy is located 2 cm lateral and 2 cm superior to the external cervical os, and the total dose should not exceed 8000 cGy.
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 350, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology 6 th edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 350, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology 6 th edition
